questions.body: Which of the answers below best describe the primary activity of the applicant?

choices.body: Sell a product/service
Fulfill a government task
Conduct applied research
Conduct basic research
None of the Above

questions.body: Which of the answers below best describe the financial structure of the applicant’s organisation?

choices.body: Largely financed through income from own activities or parent/partner company
Largely financed by way of large donations (above 5000€ or equivalent per donation)
Largely financed by governments or international organisations
Largely financed by way of small donations (up to 5000€ or equivalent per donation)
None of the Above

questions.body: Which of the answers below best describe the applicant’s public reporting requirements?

choices.body: No reporting requirements
Annual report on key financials to financial institution
Annual non-public report on activities to the funder (or other entities)
Annual report on activities to the public
None of the  above

questions.body: Which of the answers below best describe the applicant’s legal obligations to provide information to the public?

choices.body: No legal options to compel disclosure of information about it data use activities to the public beyond civil or criminal proceedings
Can be compelled to disclose information about its data use activities via freedom of information laws
None of the above (please specify)

questions.body: Which of the answers below best describe the applicant’s track record in providing information about all its activities to the public?

choices.body: Demonstrated track record of rejecting information requests (Irrespective of byway of FOI laws, other laws, or voluntarily)
No track record
Demonstrated track record of promptly responding to information requests (Irrespective of byway of FOI laws, other laws, or voluntarily)
None of the above (please specify)

questions.body: Which of the answers below best describe the applicant’s motivation for data use?

choices.body: Develop/ improve new drug/ medical treatment
Combat climate change
Combat social and economic inequality
None of the above (please specify)

questions.body: Which of the answers below best describe the main beneficiary of the applicant’s data use?

choices.body: Benefits accrue largely to the organisation
Benefits largely accrue to users of the product/service resulting from the data use
Benefits accrue to users and non-users of product/service resulting from data use
None of the above (please specify)

questions.body: Which of the answers below best describe the applicant’s track record in increasing the benefits of the applicant’s data use in the Global South?

choices.body: No track record of adjusting the data use to expand the range of beneficiaries in the Global South
Track record of adjusting the data use to expand the range of beneficiaries in the Global South
Strong track record of adjusting the data use to expand the range of beneficiaries in the Global South

questions.body: Which of the answers below best describe the applicant’s track record in strengthening benefits of the applicant’s data use for groups that are granted additional protection by way of anti-discrimination law?

choices.body: No track record of  strengthening benefits for groups that are granted additional protection by way of anti-discrimination law
Track record of strengthening benefits for groups that are granted additional protection by way of anti-discrimination law
Strong track record of strengthening benefits for groups that are granted additional protection by way of anti-discrimination law

questions.body: Which of the answers below best describe the applicant’s data use’s benefits for future generations?

choices.body: Benefits primarily cover issues of current relevance
Benefits primarily cover issues of relevance for future generations
Benefits are likely to increase in the future
Other (please specify)

questions.body: Which of the answers below best describe risks entailed in the applicant’s data use?

choices.body: Physical risk
Financial risk
Informational risk
Other (please specify)
None of the above

questions.body: Which of the answers below best describe effects of the applicant’s data use on the environment?

choices.body: Environment is negatively impacted
Environment is positively impacted
Other (please specify)

questions.body: Which of the answers below best describe the relationship between the applicant’s data use and risks?

choices.body: Risks stem directly from the applicant’s data use (direct cause)
Risks are incidental to the applicant’s data use (indirect cause)
Other (please specify)

questions.body: Which of the answers below best describe the risks for groups afforded special protection under the law (including, but not limited to, children, persons with disabilities, ethnic minorities, sexual minorities)?

choices.body: Applicant’s data use entails risk for groups afforded special protection under the law
Applicant’s data use entails no risk for groups afforded special protection under the law
None of the above (please specify)

questions.body: Which of the answers below best describe the applicant’s communication about risks of its data to the public?

choices.body: No information provided
Information about risks provided to the public at some point during the data use
Information about risks provided to the public prior to commencement of data use
None of the above (please specify)

questions.body: Which of the answers below best describe the risk of dual use?

choices.body: Dual use is likely
Dual use is unlikely but conceivable
Dual use is extremely unlikely
None of the above (please specify)

questions.body: Which of the answers below best describe the likelihood of a risk of dual use materializing and creating harm?

choices.body: Risk from dual use are likely to materialise
Risks from dual use are unlikely to materialise
Likelihood of risks from dual use cannot be assessed
None of the above (please specify)

questions.body: Which of the answers below best describe the applicant’s way of assessing risk?

choices.body: No risk assessment in place
Ex ante institutionalized/ad-hoc risk assessment is voluntary
Ex ante institutionalized risk assessment is mandatory
Other, please specify

questions.body: Which of the answers below best describe the applicant’s way of assessing risk?

choices.body: No involvement of persons from outside the organisation
Occasional/Needs-based involvement of persons from outside the organisation
Routine involvement of persons from outside the organisation
No risk assessment in place
Other, please specify

questions.body: Which of the answers below best describe the status of findings from the risk assessment?

choices.body: Findings are recommendations
Findings are binding and cannot be overruled

questions.body: Which of the answers below best describe the involvement of trained ethicists in the process of assessing risks?

choices.body: Trained ethicists are not included in the risk assessment
No risk assessment in place
Trained ethicists are included in the risk assessment
None of the above (please specify)

questions.body: Which of the answers below best describe the process of harm monitoring?

choices.body: No monitoring of harms
Harms monitored for a limited period during the data use and the deployment of the data use and the deployment of the product/service
Harms are monitored throughout the data use and the deployment of the product/service
None of the above (please specify)

questions.body: Which of the answers below best describe the ability of the applicant to stop/reverse their activity, once unexpected harms occur?

choices.body: Harm-causing activity cannot be ended immediately
Harm-causing activity Harms can be ended immediately
None of the above (please specify)

questions.body: Which of the answers below best describe the remedies available to individuals?

choices.body: No complaint procedure in place
Complaint procedure can be initiated online
Complaint procedure designed in an accessible manner
Guaranteed respond times (under 4 weeks)
